name: Procure Space ETF
description: The Procure Space ETF (PBUS) is an innovative exchange-traded fund designed to provide investors with exposure to the burgeoning space industry. Launched in 2021, PBUS seeks to track the performance of the Procure Space Index, which comprises companies involved in the development and commercialization of space-related technologies and services. This includes satellite manufacturing, launch services, space exploration, and space tourism. The fund is managed by Procure Asset Management, a firm focused on thematic investment strategies. With the increasing interest in space exploration and technology, including missions to Mars, lunar exploration, and satellite internet services, PBUS positions itself at the forefront of this rapidly evolving sector. The ETF aims to capitalize on the growth potential of the space industry, which is expected to expand significantly in the coming years due to advancements in technology and increased investments from both public and private sectors. By investing in PBUS, investors can gain diversified exposure to a range of companies innovating in the space domain, making it an attractive option for those looking to be part of the next frontier in technology and exploration.

seo.meta_title: Procure Space ETF (PBUS) | Invest in the Space Industry
seo.meta_description: Explore the Procure Space ETF (PBUS) for investment opportunities in the space sector. Gain exposure to companies involved in satellite technology, space exploration, and more.

faq.question: What is PBUS?
faq.answer: PBUS is the Procure Space ETF that offers exposure to the space industry and companies involved in space technology and services.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of the Procure Space ETF?
faq.answer: Andrew Chanin is the CEO of the Procure Space ETF.

faq.question: What companies are included in PBUS?
faq.answer: PBUS includes various companies involved in satellite manufacturing, launch services, and space exploration.

faq.question: Where can I find more information about PBUS?
faq.answer: More information can be found on the official website at https://www.procureetfs.com/pbus.
